title: Nizamabad Black Pottery
hero_image_alt: Jet black vase with silver floral inlay
short_description: Glossy black pottery from Uttar Pradesh, known for its silver floral designs engraved into the fired clay.
long_description:
Nizamabad in Azamgarh district of Uttar Pradesh is famous for its unique black pottery. The pottery gets its lustrous black color from a special firing process in a closed kiln where smoke (carbon) is trapped and impregnates the clay. 

After firing, the grooves engraved on the pottery are filled with a silvery powder made of zinc and mercury (though now often tin or lead amalgam), creating a striking contrast against the shiny black surface. The finish resembles the Bidriware metal craft but is made of clay.
traditional_methods: Polishing with smooth stones/oil before firing.
authenticity_tips: The silver inlay should not rub off easily. The surface should be high-gloss.
local_economy_note: A GI tagged craft supporting the local community.
